2.heading: Safety, Mr.
2.title: "The Big Wheels"
2.author: Russ Heath
notes: Begins: "America travels on wheels! From the first wild ride to the maternity hospital to the last quiet ride in the hearse, we live our lives on wheels. And so we now pay tribute to the auto industry, to those civic-minded citizen-scientists who labor constantly to bring a safer and saner car to today's driver. Friends and neighbors, let us join Mr. Safety himself, Mr. Honkyer Horn, president of Mayhem Motors, as he watches safety tests for the new 1954 Mayhem Motors automobiles!"

23.heading: Safety.
23.title: Endangered
23.author: written by Josh Williamson ; art & cover by Juan Santacruz.
notes: ca. 100 p. : col. ill. ; 21 cm.

"Two teenage brothers, Chris and Mikey, think their father may be the most boring man in existence. He is a safety specialist and never fails to remind his two adventuresome sons about the amazing benefit of kneepads, helmets, etc. When their father fails to return from a business trip, the two brothers are shocked to find an attractive alien teenage girl in the living room. She informs them that their father is an intergalactic space hero, who has been captured by an evil alien race. It is now up to them to save the universe."

Summary (from SkyRiver): Mitchell Hundred has faced countless challenges in his time as mayor of New York City, but nothing could have prepared him for America's coming war in Iraq. 95.title: Safety Dance
95.author: story by J
notes: 1 v. : ill. ; 19 cm.
(Degrassi, the Next Generation, Extra Credit ; 4)
"A Pocket Books/Madison Press Book."

"When Marco sees Dylan get into a fight with a homophobic hockey player, he's suddenly super self-conscious about the way the world looks at him. Dylan wants to take their relationship to the next level, but Marco is holding them back. What will it take for Marco to move forward? Ashley is back from merry ol' England but she's finding it hard to reconnect with her stepbrother Toby and to rekindle the romance with ex-boyfriend Jimmy. Is her talk of all things British keeping them at a distance? Or is it her hideous hat?"

126.heading: Safety Pins.
126.title: "My Little Margie's Nightmare"
126.author: by Pat Masulli & Jon D'Agostino
126.appears_in: 6 p. in My Little Margie's Fashions, no. 2 (Apr. 1959).
notes: Summary (by Amy Lazet): Margie watches a movie with her boyfriend, about evil Martians. When she goes home, every little sound makes her jump, but she's determined not to let it bother her. She has a fashion show tomorrow and needs her beauty sleep. But Margie dreams she is on another planet surround by aliens clad in safety-pinned diapers. The aliens are friendly until Margie refuses to wear their diaper uniform. Margie offers instead to let them select any of the clothing in her suitcases, but the aliens insist that she can either wear their clothing or be thrown in a dungeon. Margie wakes up and heads for the fashion show, where a large sign heralds a surprise outfit, and she realizes that it's the diaper attire of the aliens in her dreams.

130.heading: Safety Tests.
130.title: "The Big Wheels"
130.author: Russ Heath
notes: Begins: "America travels on wheels! From the first wild ride to the maternity hospital to the last quiet ride in the hearse, we live our lives on wheels. And so we now pay tribute to the auto industry, to those civic-minded citizen-scientists who labor constantly to bring a safer and saner car to today's driver. Friends and neighbors, let us join Mr. Safety himself, Mr. Honkyer Horn, president of Mayhem Motors, as he watches safety tests for the new 1954 Mayhem Motors automobiles!"
